name: Savic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from our 2 night stay at the Savic, 14th April to 16th, and loved every minute. Thanks to other users of Tripadvisor, I managed to get a free upgrade to the infamous room '204' after informing them by email that this would be an extra sepcial trip (We were going to get engaged, as long as she said yes!!), I simply asked for their best double but they put us in their best Suite instead!!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Savic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were spot on, the hotel immaculate and the room, one of, if not the best we have stayed. The location cannot be beaten, right near to everything without the worry of any noise late at night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Our Room was beautiful and very well appointed
likes.disliked: — should have more then news channel in english a movie or sitcom would be nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The breakfast was first class, varied selection to suit all requirements.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in Prague!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A must if you are visiting Prague and want that little bit extra.
reviews.title: Room 204!!!!
Perfect hotel
reviews.text: Trusted Trip Advisor as usual and as usual was extremely pleased...What a great hotel...Beautifully appointed rooms (even had a lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom) Our room was large and luxurious... Great Bed , Flat Screen TV.....The staff was excellent (especially Peter) Location Location Location.....right next to old town square but tucked in a side street which cut down on the noise factor>>>.We had our windows open every night and it was fine ......Breakfast was very good...nothing lacking...I would check back into the Savic in a minute...and hope to return one day soon....Oh and I loved Prague!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from our trip to Prague(Praha, Praga) and we stayed at the Savic Hotel. We found the hotel to be an excellent value. The bed was very comfortable. The room was a good size considering the location. Most hotels in European cities are small.The airconditioning worked well. You have to leave your room key in a slot inside the door to activate the power. The rooms are very quiet as well. The elevator is a good size for moving your luggage. The breakfast is excellent. You can get eggs the way you want them, or an omelette or pancakes. The front desk staff spoke english well and were very willing to answer all your questions and suggest restaurants in the area. The location is excellent it is only about 3 mins walk to the Astronomical clock. The high end shopping street is only about 7 minutes walk away if you want to spend alot of money. ;) Needless to say we only window shopped. lol I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh yes and unlike most hotels in Europe the Savic had an actual wash cloth in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property:
reviews.title: Standing ovation with shouts for repeated encores!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just a beautiful property in a renovated historical building. Great rooms; we had two on different days. The public spaces are charming and brimming with visions of, perhaps, Mozart having played here for the rich owners when he lived in Prague.
reviews.title: just great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location:
reviews.title: Service and style in the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very close to the Charles Bridge and the Old Town Square. In fact, if there is a criticism of the hotel it would be that it is too close to the most popular tourist attractions. The area is wall-to-wall people during the afternoon. And at night, the usual ill-mannered drunks shouting and breaking bottles are all too common.
reviews.title: Magical Prague - Magical Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really beautiful hotel situated right in the heart of the old town. It has character in abundance with very friendly and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in the Heart of Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived quite late on the evening we were checking in. We were greeted by an extremely helpful and very nice lady on reception. Unfortunately I didn’t get her name to thank her but she really set the tone for our stay. We were offered a welcome drink on arrival which was very refreshing after spending a day travelling.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor of the hotel overlooking a side street. The room was extremely spacious with beautiful large bedside lamps mixing the old and new of the room elegantly. The bathroom was marble from floor to ceiling with l’occitane toiletries. The bed was very comfortable with a large Samsung flatscreen t.v. directly in front of the bed. Again, the blend of old and new was stylish and worked very well with the large wooden bed and the rather luxurious wooden furniture. Included in our rate was breakfast served until 10.30 each morning. It was very nice with a good selection of pastries, fruits, cereals etc all served in the courtyard of the hotel which is covered with a glass ceiling.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I was asked for one flaw with the hotel I would have to say it was the noise coming from the busy streets of the old town. It didn’t bother us too much as we were on the 3rd floor, however, I do intend to stay here again and I will be asking for a room off the street just encase! If we were on the 1st floor or if our room overlooked the other street (there is a bar almost directly across from the hotels main entrance) which the hotel looks on to then it may have been a slightly different review. This aside, our stay was fantastic and I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel for an amazing price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a short stay in Prague and it has been a fantastic few days. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities we have ever seen with glorious vistas around every corner. The fact that we had booked into Hotel Savic was the icing on the cake. The hotel is beautiful - the rooms delightfully and tastefully furnished and the epitome of the small boutique hotel. Breakfasts were delicious with something to suit all tastes. The hotel's situation is perfect; being in the heart of the Old Town nothing is more than a leisurely walk away. Little tip for those who are not partial to stew and dumplings - eat Italian or French (we easily found both types of restaurant - La Coppola in the Jewish quarter was excellent as was Cafe de Paris in the Embassy area across Charles Bridge). Unfortunately we found that Czech food is very light on fresh vegetables and can be 'stodgy'. Having said that, we are looking forward to our return visit to beautiful Prague and the lovely Hotel Savic..
reviews.title: The Savic Hotel is a Great Hotel in a Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tripadvisor has never let me down!
reviews.title: Superb on every level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on the reviews and it was brilliant.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel right in the centre of the Old Town

likes.liked: — The location is just about perfect. It's in the old town close to all of the significant places of interest.
likes.disliked: — Shower door in the bathroom leaked, staff in the restaurant seemed to spend more time arguing between themselves than serving the customers.

reviews.title: pleasant surprise

likes.disliked: — nothing really, except I do prefer the mala strana side of Prague, but for tourists wanting to be close to the old town square this is perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: in terms of location this place is literally right around the corner from the astronomical clock & the old town square so for my mom that is super talented at getting lost it's a great location, I myself prefer the mala strana neighborhood that is not as frentic (stayed last time in an Arcadia residence apartment)
reviews.title: superb experience in hotel savic

likes.liked: — Unusual style of building and hospitality of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as this stay was part of an extended holiday I didn't have much time to plan for hotels or do my research, the Savic hotel turned out to be quite a pleasant surprise, while my parents' room on the 3rd floor was a bit small my room on the 4th floor (attic) was very cute and charming, I loved the way the room looked, felt, the bathroom was great, I'm sure with the right photographer the room would not have looked out of place in Herbert's hip hotels atlas.
reviews.title: Smiling Savic
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: breakfast was included and quite good, location was convenient, the rooms were very comfy, service was good, I couldn't find anything to complain about except that I couldn't get my aircon to work very well (but it wasn't hot yet)

reviews.title: would definatley stay again
reviews.text: My two daughters and I have just returned from 3 nights in Prague from the 24th to the 27th April. It was a superb experience. We stayed in hotel Savic. We were upgraded to a suite on our arrival. The suite was very luxurious and catapulted us back to the middle ages with the latest in modern luxury thrown in as well.It was one of the most unusual hotel rooms we have ever stayed in.We truly unwound and relaxed in this environment after our many forays out to enjoy the sights of Prague. The staff were on hand at all times to help out with advice and directions and they were so genuinely friendly and welcoming. The hotel and staff truly made our stay a very positive experience. We enjoyed the varied breakfast and there was a very nice bar across from the entrance where we relaxed at the end of the day. A superb experience all round. Kay Delaney, Sutton, Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: A charming hotel nestled in the side streets near to the old town square. The staff were the nicest I have encountered nothing was too much trouble. All the positive comments already stated I would endorse and would not hesitate to stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fantastic !!
reviews.title: Wish I could stay for ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I love places where they have clearly put thought into every aspect of their accommodattions. I liked everything about this historical monastery turned hotel down to the music they played in their lobby. Very hardworking staff, yummy breakfasts, key location, and beds lovely enough to marry. Wish I could at least stay longer if not for ever. One tip, ask them to pick you up from the airport or train station, much much cheaper than the scam artists who think they can ride on your ignorance.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Savic for 2 nights as a surprise for my husband’s 50th birthday. We travelled with our 2 older teenage daughters and booked 2 rooms direct with the hotel (double & twin) and they price matched a cheaper offer I’d seen on another website providing I paid in advance and understood it was non-refundable which I was happy to do. The main entrance to the hotel is actually on Jalovcova, a pedestrianised route and as we’d booked a stretch limo to take us to the hotel from the airport we had a 200m walk as the car couldn’t get close to the hotel but no big deal as we were only travelling with hand luggage.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Fantastic Front Desk, Comfy: A Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were warmly welcomed with a drink, given lots of information about the area, maps etc and informed we’d been upgraded to a suite (303) because of my husband’s birthday and the girls were 2 doors away in 301. The suite was lovely but slightly disappointed to find the bathroom although beautifully appointed together with L’Occitane shower gel, soap, shampoo, conditioner and a “proper” powerful hairdryer, was dimly lit (only 3 downlighters in the ceiling) and the window was tiny and situated around the corner of the room so that didn’t help with the light situation. There was only one mirror in the whole suite and that was in the bathroom although the twin room did have an extra mirror in the bedroom and their bathroom was a bit lighter but not much. The bed was huge and comfy but didn’t care much for the pillows – everyone else thought they were ok so perhaps it was just me! There was a fancy coffee machine (no kettle) and the only English language programs on TV were news channels but we weren’t in Prague to watch TV so didn’t bother us. The suite was reached by lots of steps after you opened the front door (bit like going up the steps in the “Dragon’s Den” TV program) and even though all floors are served by lifts there are still several steps to reach the rooms so may not be suitable for everyone.
reviews.title: An exceptional location, welcoming staff and great room. It's A-OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights on the basis of previous Trip Advisor reports and were not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was good and the coffee machine in the room used regularly. We were disappointed with some of the evening meals we had in the hotel and felt they could have been better. The bed was not changed at all whilst we were there and better quality towels would have been nice as would dressing gowns. Having said this if you are going to this hotel you will love it. The only downside for me personally in the hotel was the fact that it is all non smoking and being told if I wanted a cigarette I would have to go outside, particularly with the weather whilst we were there, was not great. Probably an ideal place for people who don't smoke but if you do you might be as well to book somewhere else. It is the only thing that would stop me returning to this otherwise wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Definitely a "Boutique Hotel" and sanctuary in the middle of Old Town!!
reviews.text: Location, Location, Location!!!! This hotel with its amazing breakfasts, an incredible Jana at the reception desk, and lovely rooms was a perfect spot for eight good friends to stay while touring Prague. The Gathering Rooms on each floor was a great place to meet one another at the beginning or end of the day. The outdoor eating area was a wonderful people-watching place to have appetizers and drinks while we waited for one another!! And all of this in the middle of the shopping area, minutes from the center of Old Town, and minutes from the Charles Bridge. We would definitely recommend this as well as return ourselves!!! Thank you again, Jana!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have enjoyed our stay in Prague more. The room was spacious and nicely appointed, and looked much nicer in person than in the photos on Tripadvisor and at the Savic's web site, so we were pleasantly surprised upon check-in. The staff was pleasant and very helpful, the breakfast buffett was well stocked and nicely prepared, and had an extraorinary variety of fresh fruit available. And the location was perfect: centrally located, and a very short walk to the main square in Old Town.
reviews.title: Great location, great room, great service, great stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not recommend the Savic Hotel highly enough. The service was excellent – we met two receptionists in our stay and both were extremely helpful and friendly way beyond the call of duty. Also, the service in the breakfast room was outstanding - at times there seemed to be more staff than guests! The choice at breakfast was wonderful – the best I’ve experienced for this type of hotel.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a gem. A very old building which has been renovated most tastefully with lots of lovely old features being retained. Our room was excellent with a first-class bathroom. The location of the hotel is absolutely spot-on. Down a little windy street close to the Charles Bridge. All in all I really couldn’t find fault with the hotel except that perhaps the restaurant was a little expensive compared to some of the surrounding places.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed in this great luxurious room with terrific amenities and superb service. The suite was done up in excellent taste and the bed was extremely comfortable for a good nights sleep. The buffet breakfast was excellent with the cook willing to make good vegetarian dishes for me .... most of all walk straight into the Prague culture and the liveliest and best sightseeing or shopping area of Prague .... the church, the Charles bridge, the square, ...... the greatest of eating places. Truly the best place to stay on business or pleasure with family or on a honeymoon
reviews.title: Greatest place to stay and see Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights in november and were very pleased indeed. Perfect location, hospitable arrival to the hotel and spacious luxurious room. Excellent breakfast buffet was another big plus. We felt we got very much value for money (paid about 70 euro per night). Close by is a little known but very cool and good restaurant - Klub Architectu.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel with my wife and we were absolutely stunned. Found the hotel in Tripadvisor and convinced our Czech friend who accompanied us in Prague to try this hotel. After our stay he said it is simply the best hotel he has ever been in Prague and he has certainly a vast hotel experience.
reviews.title: Outstanding
Very pleased indeed!
reviews.text: The fantastic service starts right at the entrance, the receptionist was extremely helpful and courteous, we just fell in love with the hotel immediately -our Czech friend too-.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are oustanding tastefully decorated they succesfully restored parts of the old beautiful wall and ceiling features of this 14th century old building but with all modern facilities.
reviews.title: Superb hotel with excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Savic hotel was really luxurious - the rooms were really plush with lovely crisp sheets and top quality furniture, a coffee machine in each room with special coffees provided. Hotel staff on reception really helpful and friendly (sent up a bottle of sparkling rose when they found out it was my friends birthday) although some of the waiting staff were a bit hit and miss. Lovely breakfast with freshly cooked eggs bacon etc. selection of fruit and cheeses, meats, breads, juices, coffees and teas. The best part of this hotel was that it was in the centre of where it all happens and a great base to see Prague. Cost was around £100 per night for a double room (I had a queen size bed in my room) which is a bit pricey but the location was great and hotel decor was quality stuff. PS Night boat trip was brilliant but make sure you choose the right entertainment as the one we chose was useless (although the buffet was good) a man playing an accordian and a bit grim looking - the jazz boat looked alot more livelier and I think the menu was a la carte, plus we saw another with a girl singer and boy playing either a piano or a guitar both were so much better that the one we chose.
reviews.title: Luxury throughout and in the centre of it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When planning our visit to Prague we consulted TripAdvisor and chose the Savic Hotel based on the reviews. The hotel was everything we expected and more. It is centrally located, the staff (maybe with the exception of the dining room staff) were friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms were very comfortable - we had a 4th floor room that was very quiet, but had only a very small window that afforded a good view if you climbed up and looked out. The entire hotel was very nice, an excellent renovation job with exposed beams, bright and cheery. Definitely a great place to stay in old town Prague.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a very pleasant stay in Hotel Savic. The staff were very welcoming on arrival even though it was after midnight. The location is fantastic for exploring the old town, walking to the Charles Bridge and the river. Our room was a good size, nicely furnished with a lovely bathroom and gorgeous chandelier. Thereare also a couple of beautifully furnished residents' lounges throughout the hotel which are very relaxing after a busy day's sight seeing.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is plenty of selection for breakfast which is buffet style. The only downside to our visit to the hotel was as evening meal we ordered at the inside restaurant We waited for nearly an hour before we were even offered a drink, there were eight people in our party and all the meals arrived at different times and we waited well over an hour before the food was served. We were the only people in the restaurant so it wasn't even that busy. There is a pavement cafe/restaurant attached to the hotel so I can only assume this section was busy and were using the same staff hence the long delay. A staffing problem maybe?
reviews.title: Good hotel and good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Apart from this small glitch I would recommend the hotel as being ideal for exploring Prague and it's many delights. Overall the hotel is of a high standard
reviews.title: In the heart of Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read a lot about this hotel beforehand and was not disappointed. I emailed them a short time before we travelled and explained that it was our wedding anniversary and that my wife was recovering after a serious operation so had a little trouble walking and managing stairs.
reviews.title: Perfect Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel organised a taxi to collect us at the airport, which was waiting promptly for our arrival. After a very warm welcome and a complimentary drink we retired to our room, or should I say suite, only to find a lovely chilled bottle of Czech champagne with a personalised letter to congratulate us on our wedding anniversary!
reviews.title: One of best hotels I stayed in
Be warned!
reviews.text: The suite, which was close to the lift and easy for my wife to walk to, was just splendid with beautiful period furniture and a stunning bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The locality of the hotel is ideal and so convenient for all the main attractions. At the same time you only have to stroll 100 metres to find cosy and reasonably priced bars and cafes. The breakfast was a bonus, with freshly cooked omlettes, bacon, fruit and chilled pink sparkly.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, beautiful rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for the reception staff who were knowledgeable and friendly. Wireless internet was free; just ask reception for the daily code. We will be back to the excellent Hotel Savic!!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect!!!! Stayed 3 nights for my 35th B'day and how lovely it was. great location, only minutes from all sights. lovely accomidation and friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you. Evan had a B'day treat from them!!! will return and recommend.......
reviews.title: What a Gem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed at many 5-star hotels but Savic takes the first place because of the staff. The receptionists went out of their way to provide an excellent service - always very friendly and always with a big smile.
reviews.title: Best ever hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are big and very nicely decorated , the bathroom was perfect and the location of the hotel is perfect. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Savic for a romantic weekend break. Everyone was courteous, helpful and polite, and went out of their way to help us. The hotel is quiet and relaxed, without being stuffy. The location is perfect - you are just a couple of minutes away from the Old Town Square, yet in a quiet street just away from the crowds of tourists. Prague is a lovely city and this is surely the best hotel for experiencing it!
reviews.title: Good, but need more staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the hotel has a great location, spacious room with nice decor, nice breakfast and sincere staff.
reviews.title: When in Prague Stay at Savic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Returned yesterday form a 4 night stay with 3 other couples at this gem of a hotel. Right from the onset when given drinks while we checked in, everything was lovely and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Our rooms were beautiful, clean, with huge beds and extra special bathrooms . Breakfast was plentiful, and replaced quickly when items ran low. We ate at the hotel resturant and were not dissapointed. All in all we had a wonderful time and would all highly recommend staying here. We shall be calling again!
reviews.title: A little gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (one couple 30 years old and grandparents 75 years old) stayed at Savic hotel in the end of May. Being very different age, we all enjoyed our stay in Prague a lot. We can recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates good service.
reviews.title: Never had service like at Savic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tell you one example: We were not very lucky with the weather. Since it was raining I asked the receptionist where we could buy umbrellas. I was amazed when she said that the hotel could borrow us umbrellas and that we could keep them as long as we wanted. So the service was wonderful!
reviews.title: A beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And they serve sparkling wine during breakfast... What a nice way to start another day of holiday!
reviews.title: excellent hotel , but!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from staying for a three night stay at The Savic Hotel.
reviews.title: Good Stay

description: The Gothic and Renaissance building, which has in it the original ceiling in certain parts dating to the year 1319, is one of few in Prague. The Savic Hotel is situated in the heart of the city centre at Old Town Square, just a few steps away, on the cobbled streets, from the famous Astronomical Clock.
